description:
Rapid multi-purpose testing

Presented by Holger Krekel

Want to rapidly test code, javascript or documents on different Python
Interpreters and versions? This talk gives an overview on new py.test
features of the last year. I'll discuss the minimal-boilerplate testing
and new plugin model and give an overview on which testing needs are
covered so far, for example:

-  run tests written for nose or unittest
-  ad-hoc distribute tests to local or remote Python environments
-  test compatibility with Python3
-  run javascript unit-tests in real browsers
-  coverage testing
-  django-specific testing

I'll conclude with upcoming features regarding testing-in-the-cloud and
plans on more test tool convergence. (URL:
`http://pytest.org <http://pytest.org/>`__)
